episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the extensive rulebook required for tennis umpires, the unique tax system in Mexico allowing artists to pay taxes with artwork, the relationship between rainbow sizes and air pollution, and the surprising prevalence of drug references in country music.

facts.fact: To be a tennis umpire, you have to learn a 230-page book.
In Mexico, artists can pay their taxes in artwork.
The size of a rainbow can tell you how polluted the air is.
A new study has revealed that the genre of music with the most references to drugs is country music.
